titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Augden Bridgewater, Indictment
CWG0994

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Lincoln CIRCUIT COURT.
THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
AGAINST
Augden Bridgewater

The Grand Jury of Lincoln County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Augden Bridgewater of the Crime of horse-stealing commited as follows, viz: the said Augden Bridgewater did on the 5th day of September 1865, in the County aforesaid unlawfully and feloniously steal, take and carry away from the possession of Jennie Adams one horse of the value of one hundred dollars, the personal property of the said Jennie Adams, and converted the same to his own use and benefit.
Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

M. H. Owsley,
Attorney for the Commonwealth

A true copy
Attest
C L C C

COMMONWEALTH INDICTMENT FOR Horse Stealing
VERSUS
Augden Bridgewater
A TRUE BILL.
R. W. Givens
Foreman.
186. Filed
WITNESSES EXAMINED,
